channel.title: Epicurus help
channel.description: Fuck Epicurus. Every single skill is fucked.

item.title: Epicurus help
item.dc:creator: @Murk3d09 Murk3d09
item.description:
@Murk3d09 wrote:

ohokay:

It reads doors from a cfg file I think, if your door isn’t in the cfg file it won’t open.

when I add doors to doors.cfg nothing happens. I’ve tried with multiple doors and I’ve used every coord possible and nothing has made a difference.

Also, I cannot get the server to allow others to connect.

I have port forwarded, I have allowed 43594 through my firewall, I have changed the IP both client and server sided to the IP used in my no-ip DUC. Nada. I can connect to the server locally but my brother cannot connect from the outside.

Read full topic

item.title: Epicurus help
item.dc:creator: @ohokay ohokay
item.description:

It reads doors from a cfg file I think, if your door isn’t in the cfg file it won’t open.

item.title: Epicurus help
item.dc:creator: @Murk3d09 Murk3d09
item.description:
@Murk3d09 wrote:

BrandonRSPS:

Glad to hear it’s working.

Yup, thanks for replying.

Only need to figure out the doors, and the examine now. I’ve given up on the ropes, I’m going to use something else like a gate or fence… or a small table or something.

Read full topic

item.title: Epicurus help
item.dc:creator: @BrandonRSPS BrandonRSPS
item.description:
@BrandonRSPS wrote:

Glad to hear it’s working.

Read full topic

item.title: Epicurus help
item.dc:creator: @Murk3d09 Murk3d09
item.description:
@Murk3d09 wrote:

It’s a 317, but I think it’s loading 600+ because I can spawn 614 items and objects.

I have ran as admin a few times in a row, with luck on the 4th try. All the shops appeared, now I am afraid to close the program for fear of never getting it to work properly again lol. I’m going to make sure I have all my shops completed before I close it.

Read full topic

item.title: Epicurus help
item.dc:creator: @BrandonRSPS BrandonRSPS
item.description:
@BrandonRSPS wrote:

[quote=“Murk3d09, post:5, topic:543824”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=662704.msg4429162#msg4429162 date=1402370826]
I’m sure you could right click the file and open it in notepad. I highly doubt that there’s anymore more than a bunch of numbers in there.

if the shopeditor is a .jar open it with a batch file to see if it has any errors.

Again, you might not be able to find their object ID’s for a many of reasons. If they have no options (like examine etc), that makes things harder. If they do you can edit your client sided code to show the object ID directly next to where the examine option is.
3340 Guide rope
3341 Guide rope
I found these, idk if they’re what you’re looking for though. IF they show up invisible when you spawn them with object type 10, change the type.
I believe there is 0-22 for object types.
[/quote]

It’s not a bunch of a numbers, it’s a bunch of boxes and question marks and weird markings, and shop names.

The Shop Editor is a .exe and it runs fine, just doesn’t show any of the existing shops to edit.

Also, those ropes seem to be ropes that tie down a tent or bridge, and the red ropes I mentioned don’t have an examine option. They’re just there.[/quote]
This is something I’d expect to find in a 562+
What revision is your server?
I think that the problem is that the file is write-protected of some type, so I am going to ask this:
Have you tried running the ShopEditor.exe as an administrator? (Right click the file > Run as administrator)

Read full topic

item.title: Epicurus help
item.dc:creator: @Murk3d09 Murk3d09
item.description:
@Murk3d09 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:4, topic:543824”]I’m sure you could right click the file and open it in notepad. I highly doubt that there’s anymore more than a bunch of numbers in there.

if the shopeditor is a .jar open it with a batch file to see if it has any errors.

Again, you might not be able to find their object ID’s for a many of reasons. If they have no options (like examine etc), that makes things harder. If they do you can edit your client sided code to show the object ID directly next to where the examine option is.
3340 Guide rope
3341 Guide rope
I found these, idk if they’re what you’re looking for though. IF they show up invisible when you spawn them with object type 10, change the type.
I believe there is 0-22 for object types.[/quote]

It’s not a bunch of a numbers, it’s a bunch of boxes and question marks and weird markings, and shop names.

The Shop Editor is a .exe and it runs fine, just doesn’t show any of the existing shops to edit.

Also, those ropes seem to be ropes that tie down a tent or bridge, and the red ropes I mentioned don’t have an examine option. They’re just there.

Read full topic

item.title: Epicurus help
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Murk3d09, post:3, topic:543824”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=662704.msg4429153#msg4429153 date=1402369800]
3. All “map objects” can be spawned, you just need it’s ID and you need to set the object type correctly. Not everything is object type 10.

  1. Show us the code related to your doors.

  2. Is there anything actually stopping you from doing it without the program/tool?
    [/quote]

  3. I cannot find the ID for them.


These are what i’m after.

[spoiler=code]Starts with this:

public class ObjectHandler {

public List<RSObjects> globalObjects = new ArrayList<RSObjects>();

public ObjectHandler() {
	loadGlobalObjects(Config.DATA_LOCATION() + "cfg/global-objects.cfg");
	loadDoorConfig(Config.GENERIC_DATA() + "cfg/doors.cfg");
}

methods for objects, then doors is:
/**
* Doors
**/

public static final int MAX_DOORS = 100;
public static int[][] doors = new int[MAX_DOORS][5];
public static int doorFace = 0;

public void doorHandling(int doorId, int doorX, int doorY, int doorHeight) {
	for (int i = 0; i < doors.length; i++) {
		if (doorX == doors[i][0] && doorY == doors[i][1]
				&& doorHeight == doors[i][2]) {
			if (doors[i][4] == 0) {
				doorId++;
			} else {
				doorId--;
			}
			for (Player p : PlayerHandler.getPlayerHandler().players) {
				if (p != null) {
					Client person = (Client) p;
					if (person != null) {
						if (person.heightLevel == doorHeight) {
							if (person.distanceToPoint(doorX, doorY) <= 60) {
								person.getPA().object(-1, doors[i][0],
										doors[i][1], 0, 0);
								if (doors[i][3] == 0 && doors[i][4] == 1) {
									person.getPA().object(doorId,
											doors[i][0], doors[i][1] + 1,
											-1, 0);
								} else if (doors[i][3] == -1
										&& doors[i][4] == 1) {
									person.getPA().object(doorId,
											doors[i][0] - 1, doors[i][1],
											-2, 0);
								} else if (doors[i][3] == -2
										&& doors[i][4] == 1) {
									person.getPA().object(doorId,
											doors[i][0], doors[i][1] - 1,
											-3, 0);
								} else if (doors[i][3] == -3
										&& doors[i][4] == 1) {
									person.getPA().object(doorId,
											doors[i][0] + 1, doors[i][1],
											0, 0);
								} else if (doors[i][3] == 0
										&& doors[i][4] == 0) {
									person.getPA().object(doorId,
											doors[i][0] - 1, doors[i][1],
											-3, 0);
								} else if (doors[i][3] == -1
										&& doors[i][4] == 0) {
									person.getPA().object(doorId,
											doors[i][0], doors[i][1] - 1,
											0, 0);
								} else if (doors[i][3] == -2
										&& doors[i][4] == 0) {
									person.getPA().object(doorId,
											doors[i][0] + 1, doors[i][1],
											-1, 0);
								} else if (doors[i][3] == -3
										&& doors[i][4] == 0) {
									person.getPA().object(doorId,
											doors[i][0], doors[i][1] + 1,
											-2, 0);
								}
							}
						}
					}
				}
			}
		}
	}
}

public boolean loadDoorConfig(String fileName) {
	String line = "";
	String token = "";
	String token2 = "";
	String token2_2 = "";
	String[] token3 = new String[10];
	boolean EndOfFile = false;
	BufferedReader objectFile = null;
	try {
		objectFile = new BufferedReader(new FileReader("" + fileName));
	} catch (FileNotFoundException fileex) {
		System.out.println(fileName + ": file not found.");
		return false;
	}
	try {
		line = objectFile.readLine();
	} catch (IOException ioexception) {
		System.out.println(fileName + ": error loading file.");
		return false;
	}
	int door = 0;
	while (EndOfFile == false && line != null) {
		line = line.trim();
		int spot = line.indexOf("=");
		if (spot > -1) {
			token = line.substring(0, spot);
			token = token.trim();
			token2 = line.substring(spot + 1);
			token2 = token2.trim();
			token2_2 = token2.replaceAll("\t\t", "\t");
			token2_2 = token2_2.replaceAll("\t\t", "\t");
			token2_2 = token2_2.replaceAll("\t\t", "\t");
			token2_2 = token2_2.replaceAll("\t\t", "\t");
			token2_2 = token2_2.replaceAll("\t\t", "\t");
			token3 = token2_2.split("\t");
			if (token.equals("door")) {
				doors[door][0] = Integer.parseInt(token3[0]);
				doors[door][1] = Integer.parseInt(token3[1]);
				doors[door][2] = Integer.parseInt(token3[2]);
				doors[door][3] = Integer.parseInt(token3[3]);
				doors[door][4] = Integer.parseInt(token3[4]);
				door++;
			}
		} else {
			if (line.equals("[ENDOFDOORLIST]")) {
				try {
					objectFile.close();
				} catch (IOException ioexception) {
				}
				return true;
			}
		}

[/spoiler]

  1. There is no shops.cfg, the Shop Editor saves to a shops.dat file that cannot be edited without the program.[/quote]
    I’m sure you could right click the file and open it in notepad. I highly doubt that there’s anymore more than a bunch of numbers in there.

if the shopeditor is a .jar open it with a batch file to see if it has any errors.

Again, you might not be able to find their object ID’s for a many of reasons. If they have no options (like examine etc), that makes things harder. If they do you can edit your client sided code to show the object ID directly next to where the examine option is.
3340 Guide rope
3341 Guide rope
I found these, idk if they’re what you’re looking for though. IF they show up invisible when you spawn them with object type 10, change the type.
I believe there is 0-22 for object types.

Read full topic

item.title: Epicurus help
item.dc:creator: @Murk3d09 Murk3d09
item.description:
@Murk3d09 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:2, topic:543824”]3. All “map objects” can be spawned, you just need it’s ID and you need to set the object type correctly. Not everything is object type 10.

  1. Show us the code related to your doors.

  2. Is there anything actually stopping you from doing it without the program/tool?[/quote]

  3. I cannot find the ID for them.


These are what i’m after.

[spoiler=code]Starts with this:

public class ObjectHandler {

public List<RSObjects> globalObjects = new ArrayList<RSObjects>();

public ObjectHandler() {
	loadGlobalObjects(Config.DATA_LOCATION() + "cfg/global-objects.cfg");
	loadDoorConfig(Config.GENERIC_DATA() + "cfg/doors.cfg");
}

methods for objects, then doors is:
/**
* Doors
**/

public static final int MAX_DOORS = 100;
public static int[][] doors = new int[MAX_DOORS][5];
public static int doorFace = 0;

public void doorHandling(int doorId, int doorX, int doorY, int doorHeight) {
	for (int i = 0; i < doors.length; i++) {
		if (doorX == doors[i][0] && doorY == doors[i][1]
				&& doorHeight == doors[i][2]) {
			if (doors[i][4] == 0) {
				doorId++;
			} else {
				doorId--;
			}
			for (Player p : PlayerHandler.getPlayerHandler().players) {
				if (p != null) {
					Client person = (Client) p;
					if (person != null) {
						if (person.heightLevel == doorHeight) {
							if (person.distanceToPoint(doorX, doorY) <= 60) {
								person.getPA().object(-1, doors[i][0],
										doors[i][1], 0, 0);
								if (doors[i][3] == 0 && doors[i][4] == 1) {
									person.getPA().object(doorId,
											doors[i][0], doors[i][1] + 1,
											-1, 0);
								} else if (doors[i][3] == -1
										&& doors[i][4] == 1) {
									person.getPA().object(doorId,
											doors[i][0] - 1, doors[i][1],
											-2, 0);
								} else if (doors[i][3] == -2
										&& doors[i][4] == 1) {
									person.getPA().object(doorId,
											doors[i][0], doors[i][1] - 1,
											-3, 0);
								} else if (doors[i][3] == -3
										&& doors[i][4] == 1) {
									person.getPA().object(doorId,
											doors[i][0] + 1, doors[i][1],
											0, 0);
								} else if (doors[i][3] == 0
										&& doors[i][4] == 0) {
									person.getPA().object(doorId,
											doors[i][0] - 1, doors[i][1],
											-3, 0);
								} else if (doors[i][3] == -1
										&& doors[i][4] == 0) {
									person.getPA().object(doorId,
											doors[i][0], doors[i][1] - 1,
											0, 0);
								} else if (doors[i][3] == -2
										&& doors[i][4] == 0) {
									person.getPA().object(doorId,
											doors[i][0] + 1, doors[i][1],
											-1, 0);
								} else if (doors[i][3] == -3
										&& doors[i][4] == 0) {
									person.getPA().object(doorId,
											doors[i][0], doors[i][1] + 1,
											-2, 0);
								}
							}
						}
					}
				}
			}
		}
	}
}

public boolean loadDoorConfig(String fileName) {
	String line = "";
	String token = "";
	String token2 = "";
	String token2_2 = "";
	String[] token3 = new String[10];
	boolean EndOfFile = false;
	BufferedReader objectFile = null;
	try {
		objectFile = new BufferedReader(new FileReader("" + fileName));
	} catch (FileNotFoundException fileex) {
		System.out.println(fileName + ": file not found.");
		return false;
	}
	try {
		line = objectFile.readLine();
	} catch (IOException ioexception) {
		System.out.println(fileName + ": error loading file.");
		return false;
	}
	int door = 0;
	while (EndOfFile == false && line != null) {
		line = line.trim();
		int spot = line.indexOf("=");
		if (spot > -1) {
			token = line.substring(0, spot);
			token = token.trim();
			token2 = line.substring(spot + 1);
			token2 = token2.trim();
			token2_2 = token2.replaceAll("\t\t", "\t");
			token2_2 = token2_2.replaceAll("\t\t", "\t");
			token2_2 = token2_2.replaceAll("\t\t", "\t");
			token2_2 = token2_2.replaceAll("\t\t", "\t");
			token2_2 = token2_2.replaceAll("\t\t", "\t");
			token3 = token2_2.split("\t");
			if (token.equals("door")) {
				doors[door][0] = Integer.parseInt(token3[0]);
				doors[door][1] = Integer.parseInt(token3[1]);
				doors[door][2] = Integer.parseInt(token3[2]);
				doors[door][3] = Integer.parseInt(token3[3]);
				doors[door][4] = Integer.parseInt(token3[4]);
				door++;
			}
		} else {
			if (line.equals("[ENDOFDOORLIST]")) {
				try {
					objectFile.close();
				} catch (IOException ioexception) {
				}
				return true;
			}
		}

[/spoiler]

  1. There is no shops.cfg, the Shop Editor saves to a shops.dat file that cannot be edited without the program.
